intro: Phyllorkis aristata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pale pink or white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats. Phyllorkis aristata is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, showcasing its resilience to drought.
